title: Tom Holland Wants In On This Legendary Franchise
text:
Tom Holland Wants In On This Legendary Franchise Charlie Ridgely   
Even though Tom Holland is taking off as the new Spider-Man for the Marvel Cinematic Universe, it seems that one legendary role isn't enough for the young actor. 
A user on Reddit recently posted a picture of ShortList magazine, where Tom Holland was giving an interview. Much of the talk of this interview revolved around a comment where Holland noted that he got to punch Batman - referring to Spider-Man co-star Michael Keaton. Tom Holland punched Batman from marvelstudios 
If you continue reading however, Holland makes a comment regarding another major franchise he'd like to star in. 
In the middle coulmn, about halfway down, Holland expresses his interest in portraying James Bond at some point in the future. Check out his official quote: 
"I actually want to brush up on my James Bond knowledge, because Sony release Spider-Man and Bond. I keep telling them I'm the next 007 - as a joke. But also as a kind of serious, 'C'mon guys, let's make this happen.' If I keep casually dropping it into interviews, it'll eventually happen." 
There it is, plain as day - Tom Holland would love to play James Bond. The guy is actively planting seeds to make sure it happens at some point. 
While the actor is probably too young at this point - and maybe a bit too busy - he would make a wonderful James Bond down the line. All of this experience he's getting with Spider-Man and Marvel will only help his case. 
Well, once he hangs up the web, that is.

A young Peter Parker/Spider-Man ( Tom Holland ), who made his sensational debut in Captain America: Civil War, begins to navigate his newfound identity as the web-slinging super hero in Spider-Man: Homecoming . Thrilled by his experience with the Avengers, Peter returns home, where he lives with his Aunt May (Marisa Tomei), under the watchful eye of his new mentor Tony Stark (Robert Downey, Jr.). Peter tries to fall back into his normal daily routine – distracted by thoughts of proving himself to be more than just your friendly neighborhood Spider-Man – but when the Vulture (Michael Keaton) emerges as a new villain, everything that Peter holds most important will be threatened. 
The cast features Tom Holland, Michael Keaton, Zendaya, Donald Glover, Jacob Batalon, Laura Harrier, Tony Revolori, Tyne Daly, Bokeem Woodbine, with Marisa Tomei, and Robert Downey Jr.. It also includes Jon Favreau, Martin Starr, Kenneth Choi, Michael Mando, Selenis Leyva, Isabella Amara, Jorge Lendeborg, Jr., JJ Totah, Hannibal Buress, and Jacob Batalon. 
The film is being directed by Jon Watts ( Cop Car ), based on a screenplay by Jonathan Goldstein & John Francis Daley ( Vacation reboot) and Jon Watts & Christopher Ford and Chris McKenna & Erik Sommers. 
The film is produced by Marvel boss Kevin Feige and former Sony boss Amy Pascal. Louis D’Esposito, Victoria Alonso, Patricia Whitcher, Jeremy Latcham, and Stan Lee are serving as Executive Producers.
